climbs.name: Butter Knife
climbs.fa: Herb and Jan Conn & Bill Gilson 1960 Ground Up

content.description: Climb up and behind the first flake until you can gain the right to left crack on wall facing shakers. Follow the angling crack to the two bolt anchor on top. Good beginner trad line and a obvious route when looking at this formation.
content.protection: Cams- 0.5-#4 Nuts Long Slings 2-Bolt Anchor on top
content.location: base is same as shakers "grassy patch"

content.description: This formation takes a short scramble to reach. Once you reach the grassy gully Butter Knife will be the only formation that splits the middle of this grassy gully. The lands are generally good and flat and you should notice the striking angling crack of the Conn Route.  The Conns along with Bill Gilson made the first ascent of this formation in 1960.
